item.text: Referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs, and in addition to the Committee on International Relations, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S9988; text as passed Senate: CR S9988)
Passed/agreed to in Senate: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR S9988; text as passed Senate: CR S9988)

summary.text: Expresses: (1) appreciation for the accomplishments of our Korean War veterans; (2) commitment to the ideals of freedom, peace, and democracy on the Korean Peninsula; and (3) commitment to preserving the memory of those who made the ultimate sacrifice in the Korean War and to educating future generations about their achievements.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Expresses: (1) appreciation for the accomplishments of our Korean War veterans; (2) commitment to the ideals of freedom, peace, and democracy on the Korean Peninsula; and (3) commitment to preserving the memory of those who made the ultimate sacrifice in the Korean War and to educating future generations about their achievements.

bill.title: A concurrent resolution honoring the service and sacrifice of Korean War veterans.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
